page.title: 03FARMING AND LANDSCAPE
page.content: The landscape of the farms we looked at was mainly fields which grew cereal crops such as wheat and barley. There were also a few grazing fields with cows and horses grazing in them,there were one or two ponds with ducks in them.There were seven farms in the area with some just in the boundary because of their fields. The farms were all old except for a relatively new Aubers Farm which is situated in Lower Sundon. The farms buildings or barns appeared to be poorly maintained with holes in the roofs and walls, some were abandoned.The land survey was gently undurlating and all of it was suitable for farming.Most of the fields were about 4-5 acres and were connected by roads which were of a very poor quality.
